Calculated the cophentic correlation co-efficients and stores it in the instance.

Calculates the euclidean distance error with the following formulae.

cluster_data()[source]¶

Clusters the output matrices, W and the other H matrices.

initialize_variables()[source]¶

Initializes consensus matrices. It is run before the iterations of the various trials

initialize_wh()[source]¶
run(trials, iterations, verbose=0)[source]¶

Runs the NMF algorithm for the specified iterations over the specified trials

Parameters:
  • (int} (iterations) – Number of different trials.
  • (int} – Number of iterations.
  • verbose (bool) – To increase verbosity. Defaults to 0.

bignmf.models.snmf.sparse module¶

class bignmf.models.snmf.sparse.SparseNmf(x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, k: int, spars: int, beta: int)[source]¶

Bases: bignmf.models.snmf.snmf_base.SnmfBase

The update rule used in Sparse NMF has been taken from the paper Roux, J.L. (2015). Sparse NMF – half-baked or well done ?.

initialize_wh()[source]¶

Initializes the variables that will be required for Sparse NMF.

update_weights()[source]¶

Updates W,H and A so that they converge in such a way that W.H = X

bignmf.models.snmf.standard module¶

class bignmf.models.snmf.standard.StandardNmf(x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, k: int)[source]¶

Bases: bignmf.models.snmf.snmf_base.SnmfBase

Standard Single NMF algorithm class

The algorithm facotrizes the input matrix into two subamtrices W and H. For more detailed information on the algorithm, here’s the reference to the original paper.

Lee et al. Learning the parts of objects by non-negative matrix factorization. Nature(1999);401:788–791
initialize_wh()[source]¶

Initializes the model variables.

Variables:

update_weights()[source]¶

Updates W and H so that they converge in such a way that W.H = X
